revised_title: Fungous Excrescences of the Bladder: A New Surgical Approach and Instrument
tldr: The article describes the author's observations and surgical treatment of fungous excrescences in the bladder. The author developed a new cutting forceps and canula for the extirpation of these excrescences, which were causing severe pain and bleeding in the patient. The author also discusses the differences between the polypus of the nose and the fungus of the bladder, as well as the potential dangers and benefits of the new surgical approach.
